apple.0: a hard round fruit that is white inside and has a smooth red, yellow, or green skin, which is called a peel when it has been removed. The middle part of the apple containing the seeds is called the core. Apples grow on apple trees.

banana.0: a long curved fruit with a yellow skin

call.0: to ask or tell someone to come to a place, usually so that you can talk to them
call.1: to speak loudly, or to shout to someone who is not near you
call.3: to describe or refer to someone or something in a particular way
call.4: to use a particular name or title for someone
call.5: to say loudly the names or numbers on a list
call.6: to announce that an event such as a meeting or election is going to happen
call.7: if an animal calls, it makes the sound it usually makes
call.8: to say what you think will happen, for example in politics or business
call.9: to ask for a time out  (=a short period when play stops) during a sports game
call.10: to say which of the four suits of cards will be trump  (=cards with a higher value) in a card game
call.11: to tell dancers which movements to make, especially for a square dance or ceilidh
call.12: to describe on television or radio what is happening in a race or game
call.13: if a train, bus, or ship calls somewhere, it stops there during its trip

feel.0: to be in a particular state as a result of an emotion or a physical feeling
feel.1: to have a particular way of thinking about something, especially one that depends on your emotions rather than on facts or evidence
feel.2: to touch something with your hand so that you can discover what it is like
feel.3: to notice something that is touching you or something that is happening to your body
feel.5: if something feels nice, good, strange, etc., it gives you this feeling
feel.6: to try to find something with your hands, especially because you cannot see clearly

hello.0: used as a greeting when you meet someone or begin to talk to someone on the telephone
hello.1: used for saying that you think someone is not being very sensible or is not paying attention to what is happening
hello.2: used for expressing surprise or interest

like.0: used for introducing an example of something or someone that you have just mentioned
like.1: used for saying that a type of behavior is typical of a particular person
like.2: used when saying that something appears to be true but may not be
like.3: used when you pause while you are thinking what to say next, or because of a habit in the way that you speak
like.4: used for drawing someoneâ€™s attention to what you are going to say, either because it is new information or because it is important
like.5: used when asking someone to do something that they might not want to do
like.6: used when you are reporting what someone has said or thought
like.7: used for showing that the information you are giving is not exact or that you are describing something in a way that makes it seem better, worse, larger, etc. than it really is

love.0: to like or enjoy something very much
love.1: to be very strongly attracted to someone in an emotional and sexual way
love.2: to care very much about someone, especially members of your family or close friends

environmental.0: relating to the natural world and the effect that human activity has on it

buzz.0: when an insect such as a fly or bee buzzes, it makes a rough continuous sound
buzz.1: if a place or group of people is buzzing, there is a lot of noise or activity
buzz.2: to fly an airplane low over people or buildings
buzz.3: to move around quickly and busily

ambition.0: something that you very much want to do, usually something that is difficult to achieve
ambition.1: the feeling that you want very much to become successful, rich, famous, etc.

determine.1: to control what something will be
determine.2: to calculate something, or to discover it by examining evidence
determine.3: to decide that you really want to do something
